fields.summary: MockRM should clear the QueueMetrics when it starts

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: When get transitioned to standby, the RM will shutdown the existing metric system and relaunch a new one. This will cause the jvm metrics and ugi metrics to miss in the new metric system.
fields.summary: JVM and UGI metrics disappear after RM is once transitioned to standby mode

comments.body:
This is a patch to quickly fix the problem. I'm reattaching the JvmMetrics after the rm got transitioned to standby state. UgiMetrics is a different story since it fails when get reattached. As a quick fix I recreate it. 

Right now this patch is just demo for a quick fix. I think the root contradiction here is our metric system does not quite consider the case when a metric system got restarted (and metrics got reattached), while the RM HA code relaunches the metric system. If there are more elegant ways to fix this please do let me know. Thanks!

This also comes up as an issue with some unit tests.  I agree that the root issue is the erroneous assumption that the RM and scheduler won't be started a second time from within the same VM.  Ideally we'd fix it below the level or the RM.  Some of the unit tests that trip on it are only creating disembodied schedulers.

Thanks [~templedf]! 
bq. Some of the unit tests that trip on it are only creating disembodied schedulers.
Did you mean the failures for the first time, or from the second patch? I'm trying to understand with the second groups of failures, with something complaining from the protobuf level...
I meant there are unit tests that are tripping on the problems you're trying to fix. :)
Similar UT failures happened in HADOOP-12563. The patch now get reverted. I'm launching another Jenkins run for this JIRA.

This message was automatically generated.
Added an unit test for the standby metrics. The UT failures in the previous run appears to be independent to the changes in this patch. Trying them one more time.

Thanks for the review [~djp]! I totally agree that we need to refactor the code of RM HA so that the code is more maintainable. For the boolean flag here, {{initialize}} and {{fromActive}} are currently decoupled. {{createAndInitActiveServices}} has two call sites, one in RM#serviceInit, another in reinitialize. When reinitializing, we're using the flag {{initialize}} to distinguish if we need to reinitialize the active service. This method is called when we do a state transition to standby and active. Therefore, we only need to set fromActive to true when we're reinitializing the active services and is transitioning from active to standby. Due to the amount of work to refactor RM HA, maybe we want to resolve that in a separate JIRA? We can focus on a quick fix for the current symptom in this JIRA? Thanks! 

BTW, I kicked another Jenkins run to see if there are any other UT problems.

Could not reproduce the UT failures locally. At least two UT failures (TestClientRMTokens and TestAMAuthorization) also appears in other unrelated JIRAs, such as YARN-3150 (a documentation patch).

bq. Due to the amount of work to refactor RM HA, maybe we want to resolve that in a separate JIRA?
Sounds good. Will file a separate JIRA to track this.

Three UT test failures are not related, HADOOP-12687 and YARN-4947 are filed before to track them.

+1. Patch LGTM. Will commit it shortly if no further comments from others.
Hi [~templedf], do you have more comments on the latest patch? If not, I will go ahead to commit this patch which is an important bug fix.
I thought [~templedf] uploaded a patch to another JIRA to this one and then deleted it? Just try to confirm... Thanks.

One pedantic little comment: lest we work against YARN-4977, can we please include a message on the throws tag in the javadoc headers?

Also, it looks like the test tests the transition from active to standby, but not back to active.  Any value in adding that last step?

bq. One pedantic little comment: lest we work against YARN-4977, can we please include a message on the throws tag in the javadoc headers?
Sure. I'll update that part. 
bq. Also, it looks like the test tests the transition from active to standby, but not back to active. Any value in adding that last step?
Not necessarily? The problem happens when we try to reinitialize the RM active service. This step happens when we call transitionToStandBy. The actual symptom also happens when the RM becomes standby from active.
New patch, removed the wrong exception tag in javadoc. Kicking Jenkins for another round on all tests.
